title: How to Make Tempting Pinkalicious Invites That Your Guests Will Find Better Than Cupcakes

steps.headline: Cut out cupcake shapes from pink cardstock and color the frosting portion with dark pink or cream.
Use glitters to decorate the cupcake and make it look mouth-watering.
On the reverse side, write or print your party details.
Enclose them in pink envelopes decorated with cupcake or Pinkalicious stickers.
Write your party details on a pink paper and roll it up to form a tube.
Buy some Pinkalicious theme balloons, insert the tube inside the balloons, and blow them up.
steps.description: The theme balloon will clearly highlight your party theme and since it’s a balloon, kids will surely have fun blowing it up for reading the invite. Although this sounds very simple, when done, this invite will be one of the best Pinkalicious party ideas that anybody would have ever come across.

steps.headline: Scan the cover of your child’s Pinkalicious book and edit it to write your party details.
steps.description: You can take the help of anyone who is proficient with Photoshop.

steps.headline: Take printouts on normal paper or maybe on cardstock and enclose them in pink envelopes decorated with Pinkalicious theme stickers.
steps.description: Bingo! Your invites are ready to be given out.

steps.headline: If you are hard-pressed with time, the store-made invites along with the party decorations will be the most convenient way of making your arrangements.

text: Cupcake Shaped Invites Cut out cupcake shapes from pink cardstock and color the frosting portion with dark pink or cream.  Use glitters to decorate the cupcake and make it look mouth-watering.  On the reverse side, write or print your party details.  Enclose them in pink envelopes decorated with cupcake or Pinkalicious stickers.  Pinkalicious Theme Balloon Invite Write your party details on a pink paper and roll it up to form a tube.  Buy some Pinkalicious theme balloons, insert the tube inside the balloons, and blow them up. The theme balloon will clearly highlight your party theme and since it’s a balloon, kids will surely have fun blowing it up for reading the invite. Although this sounds very simple, when done, this invite will be one of the best Pinkalicious party ideas that anybody would have ever come across. Book Cover Invites Scan the cover of your child’s Pinkalicious book and edit it to write your party details. You can take the help of anyone who is proficient with Photoshop. Take printouts on normal paper or maybe on cardstock and enclose them in pink envelopes decorated with Pinkalicious theme stickers. Bingo! Your invites are ready to be given out. If you are hard-pressed with time, the store-made invites along with the party decorations will be the most convenient way of making your arrangements.
